message.content:
cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.IR, cs.SD 

The paper proposes a bibliometric methodology for measuring the correspondence between industry demand and public laboratory supply in university-industry collaborations. This methodology can be applied to various fields, but the paper specifically applies it to collaborations in the hard sciences in all Italian administrative regions. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.DL (Digital Libraries) as the paper deals with bibliometric methodology. Other likely sub-categories include cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as the paper discusses the flow of knowledge in collaborations, cs.CY (Computers and Society) as the paper addresses policy-making, cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as the paper deals with measuring the intensity and direction of knowledge flows, and cs.SD (Software Development) as the paper proposes a tool for assessing research collaborations.
